text:
Yes, and sorry for the delay! So when referring to these tokens we are referring to CRM HubL functions e.g. `crm_object()`, `crm_objects()`, `crm_association()`
Here is a link to them on the developer docs for clarity: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/functions#crm-object>
<@U015SPBVBSA> What happens if you have more than 100k contacts?

Thank you Courtney. So it appears that simply calling on contact properties is not a CRM token or CRM hit or CRM call.

That's great to hear. I am still a little annoyed though that I can't use `if` functions with contact properties unless I'm using the beta. And if I'm using the beta I can't AB test. 

Unless someone knows something I don't!

I wonder, is A/B testing not available only if using CRM tokens, or is there just no A/B testing whatsoever with Programmable Email? :thinking_face: I've only seen it mentioned as not possible in the context of this new CRM limit.
<@U015SPBVBSA> Do you have any info on the above?
Great question. When I get some time today I'm going to test out that theory.

We hope to have these limits improved in coming months and the team responsible for this is working on this, so we anticipate these changing and being less restrictive.
There is no limitation on HubDB right now. And you can send AB emails with programmable email but no CRM hubl tokens for now
Yes these limits are across any email sending right now.
But transactional emails are mostly sent one at a time. So how does that work?
If these limits apply to emails sent via workflows too, then I imagine this is actually measured on a per day basis?

<@U015SPBVBSA>, while I have your attention, I have a question. If I wanted to use an `if` statement on something like `contact.firstname`, I would need my template to have the Programmable email beta turned on?
